N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2606.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

Unless defined herein, terms used in this Part shall have the
meaning set forth under section
56-0101
of the Environmental

Conservation Law (ECL). Terms used in this Part have the following
meanings: (a) Business means any
individual, sole proprietorship, partnership, corporation, limited liability
company or any other entity operating or licensed to operate in New York State, including a small business. (b) Certified equipment means equipment that has been certified by the corporation, the department or another agency of the State as eligible for funding pursuant
to this Part. (c) Corporation means
the New York State Environmental Facilities Corporation, or its successor, unless otherwise indicated. (d) Cost
means the cost of an approved eligible project, which shall include appraisal, surveying, engineering and architectural services, plans and specifications, consultant and legal services, construction and other direct expenses incident
to such project less any Federal or State funds, other than those provided
pursuant to article 56 of the ECL, for such project received or to be
received. (e) Department means the

Department of Environmental Conservation of New York State. (f) Disbursement means a transfer of State
assistance to the project owner from the corporation, or its custodian, pursuant to a State assistance contract. (g) ECL means chapter 43-B of the

Consolidated Laws of New York State, entitled the Environmental Conservation

Law. (h) Eligible project means a
business environmental compliance assistance project which enhances the quality
of the waters or air of the State through compliance with environmental laws
and regulations, or which remedies or prevents environmental deficiencies, and
which the corporation has determined is eligible for funding under this

Part. (i) Environmental compliance
assistance project means the planning, design, construction, improvement, maintenance, or acquisition of facilities, production processes, equipment, buildings or water or wastewater infrastructure for compliance with
environmental laws and regulations or other pollution avoidance
activities. (j) Financial Assistance
to Business (FAB) Program means the program for providing State assistance for
eligible projects pursuant to article 56 of the ECL and this Part. The FAB
Program includes the FAB Air Program and the FAB Water Program. (k) FAB Air Program means the program
established by ECL section 56-0611 to provide State assistance for small
business environmental compliance assistance projects which enhance the quality
of the air of the State through compliance with environmental laws and
regulations, or by remedy or prevention of environmental
deficiencies. (l) FAB Water Program
means the program established by ECL section 56-0303 to provide State
assistance for business environmental compliance assistance projects which
enhance the quality of the waters of the State through compliance with
environmental laws and regulations, or to remedy or prevent environmental
deficiencies. (m) Municipality means
any village, town or city with a population of less than one million. (n) Project means an environmental compliance
assistance project, unless otherwise specified. (o) Principal means a sole proprietor; or a
general partner of a partnership; or a majority shareholder or executive
officer of a corporation; or a member of a limited liability
corporation. (p) Project owner means
the business, municipality, school district, not-for-profit corporation or
public benefit corporation which owns or operates the environmental compliance
assistance project with respect to which State assistance is being sought, or
provided, pursuant to this Part. (q) Request for financial assistance (RFA) form means a project-specific
information sheet to be filled out by a project owner in connection with its
request for State assistance pursuant to this Part. (r) SEQRA means the State Environmental

Quality Review Act, constituting article 8 of the ECL. (s) Small business means any business which
is resident in the State, independently owned and operated, not dominant in its
field, and employs not more than 100 individuals. (t) State means the State of New

York. (u) State assistance means
moneys paid or to be paid by the corporation pursuant to this Part to, or on
behalf of, a project owner to pay all, or a portion, of the costs of an
eligible project. (v) State
assistance contract means a contract by and between the corporation and a
project owner for the payment by the corporation of State assistance. (w) State assistance payment means payment of
the State share of the cost of projects authorized by the Clean Water/Clean Air

Bond Act of 1996 to preserve, enhance, restore and improve the quality of the

State's environment. (x) Useful life
means the number of years the certified equipment is expected to remain in
service as determined by the corporation. Notes
